channel.title: Programmin'
channel.description:
So I suppose after being in RSPS for over seven years, I figured it's time to pick back-up on programming, especially Java. So I would LOVE to have some suggestions so I can start learning!
I will note that I do prefer to do things hands-on and I'm a visual learner as well, not too great with reading stuff.

item.title: Programmin'
item.dc:creator: @artem543 artem543
item.description:
@artem543 wrote:

[quote=“Soulcist, post:1, topic:535568”]So I suppose after being in RSPS for over seven years, I figured it’s time to pick back-up on programming, especially Java. So I would LOVE to have some suggestions so I can start learning!

I will note that I do prefer to do things hands-on and I’m a visual learner as well, not too great with reading stuff.[/quote]

Get on my side, I can teach you everything about clients. It’s much nicer than servers. All that graphical process. You should consider my offer seriously, Pm me if interested.

Read full topic

item.title: Programmin'
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“imthenull, post:28, topic:535568”][quote author=RS PS link=topic=654375.msg4385646#msg4385646 date=1385409392]
Watch “thenewboston” tutorials on youtube. He is a really good teacher and explains very well. I am currently using him to learn Java and I can say it is going well.
[/quote]Worst advice ever, I highly recommend that no one watch his videos. He promotes bad programming styles and doesn’t give the learner any insight on how the applications work. It’s pretty much copy and paste, except video form.[/quote]Sounds good enough for MSCP

Read full topic

item.title: Programmin'
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:20, topic:535568”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=654375.msg4384974#msg4384974 date=1385012893]

You can’t learn any programming language, which are all written languages, by not reading.

If you want to get good at programming, you’ll eventually need to read a few books.

Some people learn better by example. Most people that buy programming books never read them cover to cover.
[/quote]Lots of books teach by example. DA FUCK NOW? And, again, depending on the book, I cover to cover that shit. [/quote]

Touche, but I am merely generalizing as much as him.

Read full topic

item.title: Programmin'
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:14, topic:535568”][quote author=Slave Scyth link=topic=654375.msg4384873#msg4384873 date=1384980992]
You can’t learn any programming language, which are all written languages, by not reading.

If you want to get good at programming, you’ll eventually need to read a few books.
[/quote]

Some people learn better by example. Most people that buy programming books never read them cover to cover.[/quote]Lots of books teach by example. DA FUCK NOW? And, again, depending on the book, I cover to cover that shit.

Read full topic

item.title: Programmin'
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“Soulcist, post:15, topic:535568”][quote author=Slave Scyth link=topic=654375.msg4384873#msg4384873 date=1384980992]
You can’t learn any programming language, which are all written languages, by not reading.

If you want to get good at programming, you’ll eventually need to read a few books.
[/quote]
Well I’m not going to learn math with a teacher slapping a worksheet on my desk and expect me to read the math book beside it, that’s not how I learn and that’s not how I’ve ever learned. I’ve made sure that I at all times work-up a plan to make sure I have examples and what not.

I’m great at taking examples and putting them in almost every situation I need them in.[/quote]surely any book on any programming language is going to be full of examples? it’s not like we’re talking about books covering the theoretical concepts behind syntactical garbage collection and colocation in c++;

Read full topic

item.title: Programmin'
item.dc:creator: @holylouis holylouis

@holylouis wrote:

if u go bck up and read his post again itll say he knows its pretty much the worst way to learn java

Read full topic

item.title: Programmin'
item.dc:creator: @hadesflames hadesflames
item.description:
@hadesflames wrote:

[quote=“Soulcist, post:15, topic:535568”][quote author=Slave Scyth link=topic=654375.msg4384873#msg4384873 date=1384980992]
You can’t learn any programming language, which are all written languages, by not reading.

If you want to get good at programming, you’ll eventually need to read a few books.
[/quote]
Well I’m not going to learn math with a teacher slapping a worksheet on my desk and expect me to read the math book beside it, that’s not how I learn and that’s not how I’ve ever learned. I’ve made sure that I at all times work-up a plan to make sure I have examples and what not.

I’m great at taking examples and putting them in almost every situation I need them in.[/quote]

If you can’t learn by reading books/tutorials, then take a class, or find a tutor. Also, whoever told you jumping in to rsps is the best way to learn Java is full of shit. More like the best way to google rsps tutorials…

Read full topic

If you want to get good at programming, you’ll eventually need to read a few books.[/quote]
Well I’m not going to learn math with a teacher slapping a worksheet on my desk and expect me to read the math book beside it, that’s not how I learn and that’s not how I’ve ever learned. I’ve made sure that I at all times work-up a plan to make sure I have examples and what not.

I’m great at taking examples and putting them in almost every situation I need them in.

item.title: Programmin'
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“Si Force, post:10, topic:535568”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=654375.msg4383351#msg4383351 date=1384322038]
http://robocode.sourceforge.net/
[/quote]

I’d recommend this also, it’s a lot of fun. Myself and some college friends developed robots last year, in both a team setting and as individuals, good times were had.[/quote]
I did have a look at it and I can see how it’s quite entertaining while learning the language. I’ll be on-and-off with it, thanks for the share Silab.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“Soulcist, post:7, topic:535568”][quote author=Whackatre link=topic=654375.msg4383336#msg4383336 date=1384318691]
read a good book
[/quote]

So I suppose after being in RSPS for over seven years, I figured it’s time to pick back-up on programming, especially Java. So I would LOVE to have some suggestions so I can start learning!

[B]I will note that I do prefer to do things hands-on and I’m a visual learner as well, not too great with reading stuff.[/B]

That.[/quote]

Whackatre:

read a good book

That. [size=1pt]or, if you don’t care for using a different language to experiment (and then perhaps return to java sometime later), try this, which i linked in another thread. it’s an excellent approach for kinesthetic learners.[/size]
